Reason: The configuration option cdc_free_space_check_interval_ms in the cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the frequency at which the system checks for free space in the commit log directory. A lower value for this configuration may result in more frequent checks, potentially causing increased overhead and impacting system performance. On the other hand, a higher value may lead to less frequent checks, potentially risking running out of space and causing system failures. Therefore, any change in the value of this configuration can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and resource utilization.
